src:
Borrell assegura que les declaracions de Sánchez que feien saltar pels aires la independència judicial de la Fiscalia es van malinterpretar
El ministre d'Exteriors en funcions matisa que l'executiu pot demanar al ministeri públic que actuï en defensa de l'interès general

07 Nov 2019, 08:32

El ministre d'Afers exteriors en funcions del govern espanyol i futur alt representant de la UE, Josep Borrell, ha intentat salvar els mobles de l'executiu en una entrevista a la Cope en què ha dit que les declaracions de Pedro Sánchez que van fer saltar pels aires ahir la independència judicial de la Fiscalia es van malinterpretar. "Segons el propi estatut fiscal, [el govern espanyol] li pot demanar [a la Fiscalia] que actuï en defensa de l'interès general. Qualsevol persona ben intencionada que escolti això que no li busqui els tres peus al gat ho ha de poder entendre", ha defensat.




Sánchez passa per sobre de la independència judicial per extradir Puigdemont: "La Fiscalia depèn del govern"

Borrell ho ha comparat amb unes declaracions que va fer ell mateix en un acte ahir en què va parlar d'un "conflicte ètnic" a Catalunya, i després les va matisar: "En el sentit que hi ha un conflicte d’arrel identitària". "També se li podia haver tret punta a aquestes declaracions", ha afegit.
"Entre decisions judicials només hi caben decisions judicials, afortunadament per a nosaltres", ha dit Borrell, que ha concretat que els estats no influeixen en el poder judicial. El govern espanyol no pot fer res contra el govern belga perquè qui pren la decisió d'extradir o no l'expresident Carles Puigdemont són els jutges belgues, que són independents del govern, assegura. De la mateixa manera, el govern espanyol no ha emès cap ordre, sinó que ho ha fet el jutge, aclareix.
text:
Borrell assures that the declarations of Sánchez that made jump by the air the judicial independence of the Office of the public prosecutor were misinterpreted
The foreign minister in functions notes that the executive can ask the public prosecutor to act in defense of the general interest

07 Nov 2019, 08:32

The foreign minister in charge of the Spanish government and future EU representative, Josep Borrell, has tried to save the furniture of the executive in an interview with Cope in which he said that the statements made by Pedro Sánchez jumping over the judicial independence of the Prosecutor's Office yesterday were misinterpreted. "According to the fiscal statute, [the Spanish government] can ask [the Public Prosecutor's Office] to act in defense of the general interest. Any well-intentioned person who listens to this that does not look for the three feet of the cat should be able to understand, "he defended.




Sanchez passes over judicial independence to extradite Puigdemont: "The prosecutor's office depends on the government"

Borrell compared it with statements he made himself in an act yesterday in which he spoke of an "ethnic conflict" in Catalonia, and then he clarified them: "In the sense that there is a conflict of identity roots" . "You could also have taken a peak into these statements," he added.
"Between judicial decisions, only judicial decisions can be found, fortunately for us," said Borrell, who concluded that the states do not influence the judiciary. The Spanish government can not do anything against the Belgian government because those who make the decision to extradite or ex-president Carles Puigdemont are the Belgian judges, who are independent of the government, he says. In the same way, the Spanish government has not issued any order, but the judge has made it, it clarifies.
